result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine Rich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay the DNA surcharge, plus all costs, fees and disbursements.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS ORDERED:  Cash bail to apply.
Any balance remaining to be paid while on Extended supervision in 14CF449.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy..
Concurrent with: Concurrent to 14CF449.  Credit for 57 days.
$600.00 to Game Stop located at 10400 W. Silver Spring Drive, #300, Milwaukee, WI.  Joint and several with juvenile coactors D.M. 10/18/97 and D.B. 9/5/97.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count one. Credit for 57 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine Rich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING commencing 09/09/2014 received and filed. (35 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION.
Letter to Tamar Day regarding bail return.  (Also in 14CF440).
LETTER FROM SURETY: TAMAR DAY REGARDING BAIL REFUND FROM CASES: 14CF449 & 14CF1640
/from Justice Point, filed.

Defendant Jermaine Rich in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. The Court imposed the following sentence:

AS TO COUNT 01:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction, concurrent to 14CF449; 57 days credit.
 * Court ordered defendant to pay stipulated restitution in the amount of $600.00 to Game Stop (located at 10400 West Silver Spring Drive, #300, Milwaukee, Wisconsin), joint and several with juvenile co-actors D.M. (10/18/97) and  D.B. (9/05/97). ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.
 * Court ordered defendant to pay the DNA surcharge, plus all costs, fees and disbursements.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.

AS TO COUNT 02:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 1; 57 days credit.
 * Court ordered defendant to pay the DNA surcharge, plus all costs, fees and disbursements.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.

Any costs, surcharges or fees outstanding may be taken from prison funds in 14CF449 collected by DOC, not to exceed 25%.  Any balance left is to be paid while on extended supervision in 14CF449.  Failure to pay all amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant, which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.

Filed,
Memo regarding restitution information to Game Stop.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
8/27/14 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.  at
/approving return of $2,500.00 to person who posted same, signed and filed.  Copies returned to Attorney Webb.
/from Justice Point, filed.
Parties stipulate to set bail at $2,500.00 cash.  Court granted same; all other conditions previously ordered remain.  $2,500.00 may be returned to the person who posted same.

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  On defense request, Court granted a separate date for sentencing.    Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine Rich in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended  Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.
Count 1 - Theft (Party to a Crime), a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a) and 939.05.

Count 2 - Receiving Stolen Property, Party to a Crime, a Class  A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.34(1)(a) and 939.05.

Defendant Jermaine Rich in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has a pending case in this court.  Parties have reached a possible resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for 08-14-2014 at 08:30 am.
14RM030730  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 06-13-2014

Defendant Jermaine Rich in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Kimberley Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense withdrew its bail motion.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conferences in Branch 20.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/to Modify Bail, filed.

Attorney Robert E Webb by telephone; defendant Jermaine Rich not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case is rescheduled for bail hearing and scheduling to 6/19/14 at 8:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/from defendant to the court, received and filed. rn

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Jermaine Rich not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Webb has been appointed by the State Public Defender's Office and is now the attorney of record.  Defense counsel requested a scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
File retained in court for the next date. rn

Attorney Vincent P Guimont in court, defendant Jermaine Rich not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the Court that there is a conflict with his office in his representation of this defendant (due to juvenile co-actors).  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20 for status on counsel.  Status conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jermaine Rich in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Jermaine Rich in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine Rich in court with attorney Louis Epps for Vincent P Guimont.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case recalled to address no contact order.
 Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Game Stop 10400 W. Silver Spring #300, D.M. DOB 10/18/97, D.B. DOB 9/5/97, Peter S. and Myles T.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for ENHANCED SUPERVISION. Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jermaine Rich in court with attorney Louis Epps for Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Jermaine Rich in custody.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20. Defendant has a pending warrant in Branch 20 due to missed preliminary hearing on case #14CF449.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
